thread.title: Pelosi aide apologizes after accusing Ryan of swearing at reporters
thread.title_full: Pelosi aide apologizes after accusing Ryan of swearing at reporters | Washington Examiner

author: Pete Kasperowicz
title: Pelosi aide apologizes after accusing Ryan of swearing at reporters
text:
A key aide to House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., apologized to House Speaker Paul Ryan's staff on Tuesday after he mistakenly accused Speaker Ryan, R-Wis., of using foul language in front of reporters.
Drew Hammill, deputy chief of staff to Pelosi, posted a video to Twitter after Ryan briefed reporters on Tuesday. In the video, a voice can be heard saying, "waste of my fucking time."
Hammill tweeted out the video by saying it was "@SpeakerRyan on talking to reporters." He later deleted his tweet:
Stay abreast of the latest developments from nation's capital and beyond with curated News Alerts   news desk and delivered to your inbox.
  Washington Examiner News Alerts.   alert soon! But AshLee Strong, Ryan's national press secretary, shot back that a reporter used bad language, not Ryan.
"You should be ashamed of yourself," she wrote back to Hammill. "That was clearly a reporter next to the mic. Delete your account."
You should be ashamed of yourself. That was clearly a reporter next to the mic. Delete your account. https://t.co/MGbbTWRq8B — AshLee Strong (@AshLeeStrong) January 31, 2017 
Soon after Strong's tweet, Hammill took down his tweet and apologized.
. @BrendanBuck tells me that was not his boss. Will take his word for it and I apologized.— Drew Hammill (@Drew_Hammill) January 31, 2017
